results.title: Tai Chi (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The ancient art of Tai Chi has been practised for hundreds of years and is a valuable form of self expression which helps the mind and body to relax. Tai Chi has become increasingly popular in the often stressful framework of twentieth century living. It aims to develop a strong co-ordinated body which is able to function in a relaxed, calm manner at all times. This video methodically guides us through each graceful movement, clearly emphasising the careful attention which must be given to posture. Master Erle Montaigue, one of the foremost authorities on the original Yang style of Tai Chi, demonstrates and discusses the movements with the viewer and reaffirms its healing powers which contribute to that special sense of well-being.

Master Erle Montaigue one of the foremost authorities on the original Yang style of Tai Chi, demonstrates and discusses the movements with the viewer and reaffirms its healing powers which contribute to that special sense of wellbeing. results.title: Tai-pan = Tai pan
results.creator_credit: De Laurentiis Entertainment Group, Raffaella De Laurentiis and Daryl Duke
results.brief_description: Tai-Pan is an epic adventure-romance set against the backdrop of the founding of Hong Kong as a British colony, circa 1842, in response to the opium wars between Britain and China. The plot revolves around an unscrupulous merchant trader Dirk Struan (Bryan Brown), and his long-standing feud with a rival merchant as each battles for supremacy as the ruling British merchant, or Tai-Pan, of Hong Kong. Over the years their bitter rivalry between the two men becomes murderous resulting eventually in a momentous showdown. Based on James Clavell’s ambitious novel of the same name (the first of his Noble House series), the film simplifies the book’s intricate sub-plots, only partially succeeding in capturing the spirit, depth and complexity of its source. Cast also includes Joan Chen, John Stanton and Bill Leadbitter.

results.title: Tahere Tikitiki: the making of a Maori canoe
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and David H. Fowler
results.brief_description: Follows the building of a Maori canoe, picturing the lives of the men who make the canoe while relating the symbolic elements of Maori culture which enter into the activity.

results.title: TAFE: many different things
results.brief_description: To inform viewers in rural areas that TAFE is providing a real alternative to conventional schooling. Looks at five people of varying ages from student to housewife, and having two things in common - a rural association and involvement in TAFE courses.

results.title: Tadpoles and frogs
results.brief_description:
Captures the transformation of a tadpole into a frog. Covers each stage of development from observation and hatching of the tiny frog eggs up through the development of hind limbs and forelimbs.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Tadpole and the whale
results.creator_credit: Les Productions La Fete, Rock Demers and Jean-Claude Lord
results.brief_description: The story of a special young girl named Daphne and her extraordinary relationship with the court jesters of the ocean. Nicknamed ‘Tadpole’ she is equally at home in the sparkling water as she is on land. Through her highly developed sense of hearing and her passionate nature, Tadpole builds a musical relationship with the humpback whales who share her second home. However, Tadpole’s happy world has dark clouds on the horizon, the most foreboding being the news that the inn where her parents work is about to be sold and they will be forced to leave. Worst of all, what will happen to Elvar, her best friend, who also happens to be a dolphin?

results.title: Tad the frog
results.brief_description: Follows the development of a frog through the egg, tadpole, and adult stages. Shows the eating habits of frogs; how they breathe, grow, and live. Instills ideas on pet care and conservation of wildlife.

results.title: Tacoma Narrows Bridge collapse
results.brief_description: The original Tacoma Narrows Bridge was opened to traffic on the 1st of July 1940, after two years of construction. It collapsed four months later during a 42 mile per hour wind storm. This short film captures the bridge on the day of its collapse showing the start of resonance vibration and the nodal line on the surface of the roadway. It records a driver abandoning his vehicle as he attempts to crawls to safety while the bridge undulates beneath him. It finally show the tearing and collapse of the bridge. The film has a very short segment at the start depicting workers during the constructing stage and an official vehicle crossing the bridge during the opening ceremony.
